Comment: This is the Legislative branch. Republicans don't pass much legislation, because Democrats actually have a say in the matter. Bills need 60 votes to go through the Senate.   The stuff i assume you see as basically free for Republicans are the executive orders and stuff coming from the Executive Branch.  The Executive Branch wouldn't have quite as easy of a time with things if we still had an independent Judicial Branch.   But since the GOP can't actually pass legislation, the GOP members in the Legislative Branch have mostly focused on pushing through Trump judges and stuff. That only requires 50 votes.   This whole strategy of governing is basically from the Unitary Executive Theory that a lot of these people push. They literally want the President to have authority similar to a king.   This idea of governance is pushed by organizations like the Heritage Foundation, who are the ones picking the judges for the GOP to approve.   https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unitary_executive_theory
